title: How to Convert Notepad to Excel: Complete Step-by-Step Guide

steps.title: Open Microsoft Excel.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Excel. A quick way to do this is to type excel into the Windows search bar and click Microsoft Excel.

steps.title: Click the File menu.
steps.content: Click the File menu. It’s at the top-left corner of Excel.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . It's the bottom option, and has an icon of an open folder.

steps.title: Click Browse.
steps.content: Click Browse . It's at the bottom of the menu, also with an icon of an open folder.

steps.title: Select Text files from the file type drop-down menu.
steps.content: Select Text files from the file type drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select the text file you want to convert and click Open.
steps.content: Select the text file you want to convert and click Open . This opens the Text Import Wizard.

steps.title: Select a data type and click Next.
steps.content: Select a data type and click Next . In the ″Original data type″ section, select Delimited (if the text file contains data separated by commas, tabs, or some other method), or Fixed width (if the data is aligned in columns with spaces between each field).

steps.title: Select delimiters or field width and click Next.
steps.content: Select delimiters or field width and click Next . If you chose Delimited on the previous screen, check the box next to the symbol (or ″Space″ if it’s separated by a space) used to separate the data fields. If you selected Fixed width on the previous screen, follow the on-screen instructions to arrange your data properly.

steps.title: Select the column data format.
steps.content: Select the column data format. Choose the option under ″Column data format″ that best describes the data in the columns (e.g. Text , Date ).

steps.title: Click Finish.
steps.content: Click Finish . The ″Save As″ window will appear.

steps.title: Select Excel Workbook (*.xlsx) from the ″Save as type″ menu.
steps.content: Select Excel Workbook (*.xlsx) from the ″Save as type″ menu. It’s at the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Name the file and click Save.
steps.content: Name the file and click Save . The Notepad text file is now saved as an Excel workbook. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source
